alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 4:00PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Cumberland River At Pennington Bend affecting Davidson County. For the Cumberland River...including Pennington Bend...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River At Pennington Bend. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 42.0 feet, Low lying areas along the river around Pennington Bend are inundated from near the River Trace subdivision to the Cumberland River Greenway bridge in Shelby Bottoms Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 42.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 42.0 feet. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1000 AM CST.
